metadata.Title: CVE-2018-13302 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In FFmpeg 4.0.1, improper handling of frame types (other than EAC3_FRAME_TYPE_INDEPENDENT) that have multiple independent substreams in the handle_eac3 function in libavformat/movenc.c may trigger an out-of-array access while converting a crafted AVI file to MPEG4, leading to a denial of service or possibly unspecified other impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13302` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required
